item.description:
We will be discussing current events at the local and national levels, election results and what happens next in terms of our future party activities.

Now that we have achieved the three percent needed to officially become a "Major Party" we have to decide what we want to do about this - While there are advantages to having Major Party status, it also makes some things MUCH more difficult.  The largest problem is that getting our candidates onto the ballot becomes much harder - the number of signatures required stays the same, but the number of people that are eligible to sign a petition gets much smaller.  Thus to get a candidate onto the ballot takes 2-3 times as many raw signatures in order to ensure getting enough that are good.

We have several other challenges on both a state and national level to deal with, come learn and discuss what we will be doing about them.

ART
